7.06.text:
Welcome back to the Learn British English
Free

11.88.text: My name is Chris and I'm the teacher from

20.54.text: This is my last video of this year, 2016

25.42.text:
and we're getting very close to Christmas
now,

27.57.text:
hence I'm wearing this Christmas, seasonal
hat.

32.50.text: The point of this message is to remind you

36.12.text: about the lessons that we've done

39.28.text:
and the things we've learnt together throughout
this year.

43.74.text:
First of all, I wanted to talk about my Skype
lessons.

48.31.text:
In November, I was pleased to complete the
CELTA qualification.

53.60.text:
That's a Cambridge certificate for teaching
English as a foreign language.

58.90.text:
And this means that I've got lots more lessons
to offer you on Skype.

64.18.text: Please have a look in the video description

69.46.text: for the links to my website for these.

73.08.text:
I have my main British English lessons that
you can take

78.96.text: and I've added some new options for you now,

82.32.text: including preparation for the IELTS test.

87.33.text: I have a background in business,

93.21.text: and I can help you with job applications,

100.15.text: as well as for studying at university.

103.05.text: Those applications and CV's as well (or resumés).

109.13.text:
And another one is proof reading. This is
where you can send me things

114.77.text: for me to check and provide writing corrections.

120.83.text:
I also can consider paraphrasing - but that's
a bit more complicated.

126.27.text: Please email me for all these lessons.

128.42.text: You can find information, costs, prices, content

132.70.text: on the different links on the website

135.64.text: and you can find my details to email me

138.43.text:
and to add me on Skype where we can arrange
the lessons for you.

144.08.text:
2016, of course, has been a busy year for
me, making lessons

148.47.text: and for you learning British English.

151.55.text:
Now I'm going to remind you of a lot of the
lessons,

156.00.text:
some of my favourite ones and some of the
most popular ones, too.

161.13.text:
If you're watching on Youtube, you'll be able
to see some of the annotations -

166.65.text: the links appear on your screen -

168.55.text:
but you can also click on all of the links
to the lessons

173.33.text:
I'll be telling you about by looking again
in the description

181.78.text:
I've tried to include everything there for
you to make it easy.

187.21.text:
We started off then, with accent and pronunciation
work

191.84.text: with the busiest train stations in the UK.

197.07.text:
Then, another one that went down quite well
was a grammar lesson

203.38.text:
about how to talk about falling asleep and
waking up.

210.25.text:
We look at a range of materials of course,
we did some pronunciation and vocabulary

216.45.text:
about different vocabulary words in British
English

220.79.text: and how to get the British pronunciation correct.

224.98.text: This is the link to one of the lessons,

227.59.text:
there are many more similar to that in the
series that you can find on the Youtube channel.

235.69.text:
I made another vocabulary lesson about how
to describe specific quantities.

243.15.text: Moving away from verbal communication slightly,

247.38.text:
there was a lesson I did about common hand
gestures in Britain,

253.98.text:
what does this mean? For example. Things like
that.

259.04.text:
Something happened in 2016, in the UK, called
"Brexit".

266.83.text:
I did a lesson about that and about the changes
to our government

274.54.text:
In July, it was my honour to work with Lucy
from English with Lucy, who is quite wonderful.

284.31.text:
We did two parts to our lesson about our favourite
five idioms.

289.58.text: You can click on the one to my channel

292.57.text:
and don't forget that the other part is on
her channel.

297.45.text: I made a very popular lesson after that

304.15.text:
and another to do with items that you might
need to use

312.40.text: I've made a few about pronunciation challenges.

317.63.text:
These are ones where you can test yourself
to see how well

322.39.text:
you can pronounce certain words and then I
pronounce them at the end of the video.

329.04.text:
I made one, which was a request, about the
months of the year.

335.05.text:
And I've been a very lucky boy during this
year because as well as

338.14.text:
working with English with Lucy, who I mentioned
a moment ago,

342.95.text:
I also did a few lessons with Anna from English
Like a Native who was an absolute delight,

351.57.text:
And one link I've included is to our lesson
about phrasal verbs for sleep.

358.06.text:
We also did others about phrasal verbs and
common proverbs.

363.27.text:
Please see my channel and also hers, English
Like a Native, for those.

369.23.text:
And the last one, quite recent, was on one
of my favourite topics:

375.47.text:
British English compared to American English
-

380.58.text:
a fairly popular lesson I published was five
words to avoid in the UK.

387.18.text:
Some American words that you shouldn't use
when you're in the UK.

393.88.text:
That completes my selection of some of my
favourite lessons from this year.

401.05.text:
Thank you very much for watching and I hope
to see you in 2017 of course.

409.54.text:
Christmas and the new year are coming soon
for us in Britain,

413.90.text:
I will be going to my home town to celebrate
with my family,

420.67.text:
If you celebrate Christmas, I wish you a very
merry Christmas and happy new year

426.56.text:
and if you don't, I hope you have a nice few
weeks, too, as well,

435.47.text: Thanks once more for your time and your support,

439.15.text: and good luck learning English in the future.
